Job Title: Senior Manager of Supply Chain Planning

Location: Cincinnati, OH

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Summary

The Senior Manager of Supply Chain Planning leads the site Planning, Purchasing, and Inventory groups to maximize efficiency and minimize costs. The Senior Manager of Supply Chain Planning participates in setting the strategic plan and ensures adherence to the plan through introducing new tools and developing processes and procedures. The Senior Manager of Supply Chain Planning works collectively with internal and external customers to ensure alignment along the entire Supply Chain. The Senior Manager of Supply Chain Planning monitors vendor's qualification and performance to confirm they meet company's requirements. The Senior Manager of Supply Chain Planning leads staff in the day-to-day performance of their jobs and provides direct support as needed.

Essential Job Functions

Partners with Production and Distribution leadership to ensure inventory accuracy through timely and accurate cycle counts, MRB discipline, and ERP transactions.Partners with the Sourcing and Reliability teams to ensure proper transition for new parts and product launches.Review negative pipe (projected shortages) report and work with the Supply Chain team to investigate root causes and take corrective action.Maintain a current knowledge of company products, systems, and quality specifications.Develop talent through training and coaching the staff to achieve performance metrics.Own/lead the Planning process and recommend systems to create a world class operation. Minimize raw material and capital inventory to maximize cash flow, accuracy, and turns.Oversees the coordination with Production, Marketing, and Customer Service groups to manage the machine build plan to meet corporate capital expense budget and operations plan to satisfy customer placement commitments.Own and lead the Purchasing process of raw materials, supplies, and services to ensure product availability and eliminate unnecessary stock outs and expediting. Provide hands on support to the Purchasing team as needed. Negotiate with and develop potential suppliers to ensure best quality, price, terms, and delivery available. 

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.

The Senior Manager of Supply Chain Planning is expected and encouraged to participate in safety and health program activities including immediately reporting hazards, immediately reporting unsafe work practices and incidents to supervisors, wearing required personal protective equipment, and participating in and supporting safety committee activities.

Education & Experience

BS/BA in Supply Chain or related discipline and 10-12 years’ experience in a related field. APICS certification a plus.

Competencies – Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities

Excellent MS Office experience Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint.Strong knowledge of E1/ERP systems.Strong understanding of forecasting techniques. Strong knowledge of ERP system processes for forecasting & inventory control. Operational Manufacturing experience in both new build and refurbishment environments. Excellent leadership and coaching skills.Excellent persuasive reasoning and negotiation skills. Excellent teamwork and collaboration. Excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as internal/external customer service skills.
